author: 8BrickMario
review:
The Calculator is one of the forgettable characters in the series for me, but I got him for my villains collection. How is he?

Parts

I could see all of his parts being reapplied by creative builders, except maybe his visor.

The minifigure

The Calculator is  Noah Kuttler, a mathematical genius who records his defeats by heroes to analyze them and prevent their strategies from ever being used again. His outfit is fairly faithful to the comics, too. Starting from the top, he has a white helmet with square patterns and a visor with LCD numbers, which, in upside-down calculator speak, reads "hello". His head underneath is lavender with the exposed face printed on it, and he has a sinister grin. Under the helmet, he wears a bulky armor piece with a printed tile representing a number pad for a calculator. The design he's based on is a much sleeker suit, so I think a frontward-facing white neck bracket might have been a better mount for the tile. Underneath, his lavender torso is printed with muscle detail and a white belt, and the square patterns also feature on his arms and the sides of his legs. The legs are dual-molded to show his white boots.

Overall

He's not a design I'm in love with, but he's still nicely done and is a nice addition to the cast.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Holy Mathematical Menace Batman!
review:
Set #71017 Calculator: Here's another obscure villain and another crazy obsessed with something fairly mundane.

Calculator looks great, he's got dual-molded legs with some side printing on the top portion, some interesting looking detailing on his arms and torso which look like the buttons on a calculator and a bulky armour piece that is relatively rare outside of CMF series. His helmet features some nice printing with a great joke on the visor, and he has a printed tile piece for the calculator buttons... sadly he doesn't include any slide-rule accessories or anything else that would fit in with his calculating theme.

Overall he's a nice solid offering and a pretty strong one, his parts are all fun especially as they are a nice light purple in colour which is a rare colour to see on Minifigures. Strongly recommended.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Fun reference
review:
Opening;

Calculator is just one of those batman villains that you just can't take seriously eg(polka dot man , zebra man , calendar man , more man , condiment king ect ) But this figure is still good despite the characters goofiness .

The Minifigure-

The figure uses the standard white helmet with printing ontop , a visor with hello printed on it upside down like the old calculator trick , a lavender coloured head with a large grin , the neck attachment is the bulky armour piece with a single stud at the front and back with a 1×1 printed button print on a light grey tile , a nice torso with good arm printing and dual moulded legs with side printing .

The stand -

The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion -

this is a good figure with lots of detail but doesn't stand out loads with the rest of the figures of the series but I still recommend it .
